code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: #include <stdio.h> is needed for printf and scanf.
<stdio.h> stands for standard input-output header.
<stdio.h> is part of the runtime library only.
answer: <stdio.h> is part of the runtime library only.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: break can be used in both loops and switch statements.
continue can be used in switch statements.
continue skips the rest of the loopâ€™s body for that iteration.
answer: continue can be used in switch statements.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: A char variable in C is stored as an integer internally.
ASCII is commonly used to represent characters in C.
C uses Unicode by default for characters.
answer: C uses Unicode by default for characters.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: The goto statement changes the flow of control unconditionally.
Using goto is generally discouraged for readability.
goto can jump to another function directly.
answer: goto can jump to another function directly.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: The default value of an uninitialized local variable is zero.
Uninitialized global variables are set to zero by default.
Declaring a variable without initialization is allowed in C.
answer: The default value of an uninitialized local variable is zero.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: enum is used to create named integer constants.
enum members are assigned integer values starting from 1 by default.
enum improves code readability.
answer: enum members are assigned integer values starting from 1 by default.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: register keyword suggests storing a variable in CPU registers.
register variables can have their address taken using &.
Register storage is faster than memory access.
answer: register variables can have their address taken using &.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: typedef can be used to create aliases for data types.
typedef changes how the compiler stores the data.
typedef unsigned int uint; creates a type name uint.
answer: typedef changes how the compiler stores the data.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: In C, functions can be recursive.
Recursive functions must always have a base case to prevent infinite calls.
Recursive functions cannot call themselves directly.
answer: Recursive functions cannot call themselves directly.

code: Identify the false statement in the following.
options: extern keyword is used to declare a variable defined elsewhere.
extern allocates memory for the variable.
extern is useful for sharing variables across multiple files.
answer: extern allocates memory for the variable.
